text: Expensive compared to the other vietnamese restaurant nearby. The grill pork was salty, the rice was hard ro chew, undercooked. Not coming back.  Watch out if you dine more than 5 persons the restaurant will add 15% service in your bill , give them more tips or not it's up to you.

Worst service ever. People who came 10 minutes after us got their food and everything before we did. They don't refill your water and nor do they ask if everything is okay. Don't think I'm ever coming back to this place again. I used to love this place but not anymore.

After a high recommendation from a Vietnamese friend, I decided to try this place. I have my standby places and always open to try new ones. 

The place was nice - felt more pricier than a 6.99 or 7.99 entree place.  Service was a bit awkward a first, but never a strong suit I guess anywhere when it comes to PHO. We never went thirsty and our water glasses were always promptly filled. 

Broth was savory and not a shortage of meats. I ordered their signature and a friend ordered off the grill portion. The bowl was HUGE.  Although my bowl of Soup came our substantially earlier than my friends...always a pet peeve and makes it awkward amongst friends it was dang astute and enough to share. 

All acceptable until the bill came....ours totaled $17 bucks and change. "Hannah" came by and said that it was a 20.00 Min to use card....WHAT?!?!? I asked where the sign was and she said " I am just doing my job" as she flicked her ponytail. We scramble up $20.00 and left the balance of a 20.00 as a tip - sorry Waiter...Hannah was after all just doing her job. 

I left and asked where the sign was...Hannah swung that ponytail once more which set the tone for the entire evening and pointed to the sign. HAHAHAHAHAH it must be handwritten amongst other signage and in 12 point font!!!  I guess I should of read reviews further, apparently it's an issue for others. 

I rarely carry cash and don't like to be pressured to ordered more to get my bill over 20. Too many options out there, although the Pho was good, a side of Hannah's saucy attitude and no credit cards makes me not want to return.
The food was awesome and the service was prompt and friendly. As far as Pho goes this is the best I've ever had.

This pho restaurant is hands down the best in all of Las Vegas. The flavor is so consistent and the level of customer service is unsurpassed. The owner Jennifer is so sweet and makes sure all of her guests have the best time possible at her establishment.

This is the first time I have written a review about a restaurant. I have been to a lot of places with bad food; however the effort to write a review is daunting after already having a terrible meal. I woke up at 6 AM today to write this because I cannot contain my frustration. Of course, it is also because I semi recovered after a night of battling with my stomach after eating Jenni Pho's food. If i could give the place zero star, I would have. 
My friends and I came to eat at Jenni Pho because we wanted some pho before going out. The food portion was very big and the waiters were very nice. The environment seemed clean and nice. When the food came out, I tasted the liquid and the pho liquid was a bit sour. I order bun rieu oc myself and from the liquid, I know is 'one of the last bowls remaining' of an old pot. As an avid eater, I have a particular palette but not picky. We did not eat much since the food did not particularly taste good. The flavor was bland and it tasted pretty old. It is understandable that restaurants that open pass 1 AM is mostly for people who have been clubbing and want some food before heading home. The food does not need to be particularly tasty and I get that part. The result for eating several spoons of pho and bun rieu? One hour later, my stomach cramped up so bad as we were walking around the strip. My friends then started have similar symptoms and went straight the restroom. Our night was cut short because my stomach hurts so bad that I couldn't even walk properly. We did not get to go dance or even have a single drink. As a vietnamese, I am very disappointed and question the restaurant's ethic. After the food was cooked for several days (5-7+), you should either taste the food to make sure is still fresh or dispose of it. Feeding spoiled food to your customers while trying to maximizes profit is a terrible plan. I have travel to may places and eaten food from stalls without getting sick. If I am sick from eating food in a nice restaurant and is still laying in bed recovering on my vacation, this is unacceptable. Please be ethical and dispose your food when is spoiled. It really makes all the Vietnamese look bad because I know that we are not all money hungry and trying to maximize profit at the cost of people's health. 
FYI, if you have 'PHO' as part of the restaurant's name, make sure your PHO is at least fresh.
Customer Service is great. The food tastes amazing, especially for the prices and the decor is elegant and the setting is intimate and relaxing.

I eat here about once a week.  The pho is delicious and the broken rice dishes are all very good.  They make an excellent broth here.  Service here is great, especially from a young man called David.  He is fast, accurate and always happy.  I would recommend this place to anyone that feels looks good vietnamese food, even when its really late!
Great interior, first open concept kitchen I've seen for a Vietnamese restaurant.  The soup just did not agree with my palette.

My new must-go place next time I am in town.  Friendly staffs, nice atmosphere, clean, excellent food.  

We went with a large group of 14 people(adults and kids).  It was our first time trying this place.  They set the tables for us very quickly and sat us down.

We ordered a few of their appetizers, all very good, the kids loved the wings that we had to order more.  Pork chop over rice which was very juicy vs other places are usually dried. The broth of the beef pho (the jenni pho) was very tasty too. 

Will definitely come back.

Visited JenniPho Restaurant on Sunday May 1st with a friend for lunch and we were amazed with the welcoming from Jenni and her team. The waitress suggested some of their specials as well as answered all our questions. I had the Dancing beef , real tender  and flavorful. My friend had the shrimp pho soup and he said it was amazing food( He is very picky with food). We were in town in a conference from Phoenix - Arizona. I go often to Las Vegas for work. I recommend this restaurant very much. You will enjoy the great food they have !

First off, I'm Viet and the food here is legit.  I don't understand all the bad reviews, like seriously?  If you're giving a 1 star because you were "expecting" a bigger portion, you've got a serious problem and probably shouldn't be yelping.

Alright - on to the actual review :)

We live in NYC and was in Vegas for a bachelorette.  We can't get good Viet food back home so we decided to leave the strip to get our fix at Jenni Pho Grill.  We've been at the other location and the bun bo hue and pho was amazing.  I ordered the bun rieu here and it was exactly how my mom makes it.  The broth was fragrant and tasty, there was a perfect combination of noodle to crab meat to broth. I asked them for a side of shrimp paste because I'm Viet like that and they brought me more than enough...yumm!!  I was a happy camper and so were my gals.  

The service: the owner Jenni is super friendly and the staff did come by several times to check up on us. It was also nice to be able to speak in Vietnamese with the waitress.  Will definitely be back on my next LV trip!

I love how clean this place is!  It's one of the first pho places that I have been to that takes pride in their sanitation and keeps their restaurant clean.  I also love their bun bo hue & bun rieu.  My husband and I always make sure we make a stop here or their other location on Rainbow everytime we visit Vegas!  Thanks Jennipho for your restaurant's good food and service too!

I was in town for my birthday, I had a couple drinks, and I was craving pho. I was driving around town & I saw jenni pho grill and decided to try it out & it was one of my best decision!!! The food & the service were great!!! The pho tasted like no other.
I will for sure come back next time when I'm in town .
We like the soup but service is always a little slow. But the make your own soup choice is nice for picky eaters

Dinner on a Friday night and there were only 2 other sets of diners.
Nice decor and open kitchen view with two LATINO chefs.  Waitress, bus girl were also not from Vietnam.  No diners from Vietnam.  Draw your own conclusions but my wife and I ordered their "dancing beef" and split it between us, plus tea and bowl of rice that cost over $21.  There was over a half of the dish left (beef tasted mildly like liver) and we usually take home any left overs but not this time.  Owner not overseeing his place indicates how much interest he must have.  Good location. Will not return when there are so many other choices nearby with better food.
Took a quick trip to jenni pho with a date. And everything was phenomenal.  Great food great service highly recommended

How long does it take to soak noodle in the hot water and pour a scoop of broth over it?  If you want to wait over half hour after we ordered and had some items served, come to Jenni's Pho and Grill.  For Jenni's incompetent crew, it took over half and hour between serving spring rolls and pho!  It wasn't busy, just a bunch of clueless and inefficient young staff standing around.  To add insult to injury, they charged me $1 for extra onion without telling me.  Wtf.  After the long wait, they still got the order wrong.  I want the tai meat separate but they put it inside, essentially over cooked to my liking.  Dangit.  

Go some where else if you want pho.  There are plenty of other pho shop who will try harder to earn your money.  

0* for staff and lack of service, slow and clueless in how to operate in the food industry.
1* is generous for the overall rating.

Terrible ice coffee!  Kim Long down the street is much better, fast and attentive service.

What a terrible way to end our otherwise awesome LV trip.

This place.... where to begin.
 First off, my lady and I saw this place and decided to stop there because our normal pho spot had a line out the door. We were greeted to whom I'd assume was the owner of the establishment. She was a very nice, slightly older woman. My lady and I were seated right away by the nice lady. 

About 10mins of waiting, this older gentleman comes to take our order. My lady orders her food and hot green tea and water, but not before placing an order for potstickers. He takes my pho order with water, but he can't seem to get away fast enough. 10 more mins of waiting a young waiter comes to the table with the potstickers but no water or tea. My lady asked for a green tea smoothie since they forgot our beverages. They came back to inform us they were out of the Matcha green tea smoothie, So my lady asks for the peach smoothie then. 5mins later they comeback and say they have no more peach smoothie. So she asks if they have the mango smoothie and the waters we ordered at the start and I slide a diet coke order in there at this time. The gentleman comes back with the smoothie and waters but not my my soda.. Innocent mistake. I taste the potstickers and they are cooked but cold which makes me wonder how long they were out and if they were from an order that was sent back or changed. Maybe that's why they got to the table so quick. 

Our food gets to the table along with my diet coke. I have the beefball pho which taste pretty good. My lady has the beefball pho with added steak which also taste pretty good. We are eating and talking, our drinks are empty for about 10mins and no waiter to be found. Im looking around and notice the place isn't to packed. So where is the service?! About 20mins into the drink wait the nice lady who greeted us sat a couple tables away looks over and sees our drinks empty and tells one of the waiters to fill our drinks. Damn, it takes the head cheese cracking the whip to get some water refill and order another drink.

Oh and they charge for everything even if you get water and say "no ice please." Yeah, they charge you for the "no ice."

The pho I'd rate it a 2 ...maybe..meaning it would do in a pinch, but the service  F-ing sucked. Negitive rating if I could for service. 

Will not return and do not/will not recommend.

Worst service ever I had at las vegas restaurant.
Wiaited over one hour for the simple pho and does not even apologize.

Jenni Pho is my favorite pho spot to go to...it's always clean...the service is always on point...the food is good...and Jenni (when she's there) always welcomes every person that walks thru the door IF she's out front & not prepping food in the back! Yes she does work herself!
I've been to the Rainbow location when it first opened as well as the Spring Mtn one & I've never had any problems at either location! EVERRRR!
I even recommended this place to a lot of friends & they STILL frequent BOTH of her locations!
I highly recommend this place & always will!

we were on spring mountain road in the mood for pho and this was not a good choice at all. i ordered the rare steak pho - the meat was overcooked and the soup was so bland. i have had my fair share of good pho in the SGV, CA and the food here did not even come close. needless to say i will not be visiting jenni again.

Pros:

Pho was good
Rice dish was good

Cons:
Service was ok. 
A bit greasy.
Bake egg was salty

This is my frst time here, just wanted to try something new since my usual pgo place was packed! But this will be the frst and only time here. 

I ordered spring roll, and it was the worst spring roll ever! Theres only.shrimp, vege, and vermicelli in the spring roll. No meat at all... all the pho places that Ive been to has pork inside. The spring roll is just so plain, no taste at all....

Then I had creat my own pho and asked for 2 orders of beef ball. When I got my food, there was only 3/4 of a whole beef ball. I asked the server how many beef ball in one order and she just replied "let me check". Then she brings over another small bowl of beel ball with one whole cut beef ball inside... I guess the service is not too bad until the time when I pay. I asked for the check, placed my money on the table for a good 10mins. No one came over to pick it up until I raised my hand. The funniest thing is when the server came, she asked "do you need change?"  NO DUH! It was a $30 meal, I put $40 down, you expect me to give you $10 tip with this? 

But one thing I had to mention was the pho was pretty big portion and decent taste...

I always order the exact same items whenever I eat here. They're usually on point on things and I must say, this place to my opinion? Has the best phö in town hands down!! 
Some place should take notes on how to do,  make phö!  From the broth itself. It's just so earthy and savory... this place is by far my favorite place to get a late night grub for phö?  Or just to hang with fellow chefs in town...

This place has bad service. Asian restaurants in Vegas outside of the casino tends to have bad service, but this is by far the worse. The ambiance isn't bad, but hire some waiters. Food was very average. No need for reservation. This place is a ghost town. Lunch time and no one is here.
P1 Dac Biet is pretty good. Skip the boba milk teas because they are very bland, but other than that this place is decent.

FLAVOR, FLAVOR, FLAVOR!  Decorative interior.  Relaxing environment.  Great service.

Not sure why this place only has 3 stars... should be pushing 4.5 IMO.

Came with three others on a rainy Sunday afternoon, what else sounds better on a rainy day?! Especially in Vegas!

Great potstickers.  Perfect Vietnamese egg rolls.  DELICIOUS PHO!  You know it's bomb when you're super thirsty a couple hours later (fair warning).

The interior design of the restaurant is classy, much nicer than your typical Pho restaurants.  You can see into the kitchen through their glass wall and the kitchen appears to be in immaculate condition, so you know cleanliness is one of their priorities.  That right there makes me feel much more comfortable.

The server was very attentive to us the entire time we were there and made sure we had everything.  

Definitely one of my new favorite places. I'll be back again in the near future!

Ate here once and never returned! Tourist and people who don't know what vietnamese food is suppose to taste like might enjoy their food here.

Writing a review about this now because it was on dirty dining! 

How can you go from 44 demerits to 6 the next day? Lies! These ppl are still picking their nose and serving you food. Sick and lazy bastards.


"The other closure coming in with 44 demerits is Jenni Pho on Spring Mountain. The Vietnamese restaurant was shut down due to excessive and repeat violations and gross, unsanitary conditions.

Multiple foods were in the temperature danger zone including beef, shrimp, tripe, meatballs and tofu.

There was expired food, from two weeks to two months old. Prep tables were excessively dirty. Food was uncovered and unlabeled.

There was food debris on the can opener and knives, and small flying insects in the kitchen."

Food was average, No taste.  Services were literally hideous & horrifying.  They hired homeless Bums in this place.  Servers seemed lazy, uneducated, can hardly understand the English language, had poor mannerisms & probably still lives with mommy & daddy.  Of course, because their paychecks are so tiny.  Restaurant was almost empty at Prime lunch time & had a weird foul smell throughout the restaurant.  We left without leaving a penny for tip.  If we could sue them, we would.  Never going back.  Place will be Out of business soon.  Save yourselves from a Horrific dining experience.  DO NOT go here.  Thank you.

We were seated really fast. But after that it took ten minutes for our Waiter to ask for our drinks and order.  Another ten minutes to get our waters.  Our food was made fast but not the best I have had.  We got our food first then when we were about done eating is when we got our drinks.  Then we were done eating for about 20 minutes before we got our check!!!!

Overall We felt unimportant and more of a bother

I usually don't write a reviewed but this place has the worst service. Just came here with my wife , 4 yrs old son and 9 months daughter. We wait over 10 minutes and flag at least 3 waiters to get some water at least. They all said one minutes and never came back. My son started acting up after waiting so long so we got up and just left. If you have young kids they careless.  WOULDN'T RECOMMEND TO ANYONE WITH KIDs!!!

The service here has to be the worse service Ive experience. The waiter disregarded our table as he greeted others who were sat after us. As we asked for service, the waiter looked at us and just walked away. He didnt issue any apology of any sort.  They were busy and i just dont understand why that is. Food was subpar at best and service was awful. I would recommend pho kim long right down the street
Absolutely the best pho in Vegas! Great service, great location, nice decor comfortable atmosphere.

A couple of days ago my friends and I were craving vietnamese food and came across Jenni Pho. From the very beginning to end, the server was very nice and friendly. The pho that I ordered was really good. The broth wasn't salty, it was just perfect. However I'm giving only 4 stars because I feel like they should have more in their menu. But all in all it was really great!
This place has a very generous serving. The broth was delicious (I got the pho ga). Service was quick, and the environment was very relaxing.

We almost didn't eat here. Was looking for a quick place to eat and saw a "buffet" thinking it was quick. But it was a raw bar and had to cook stuff ourselves but didn't have time. So we ended up going next door. Nothing impressive, typical asian food restaurant  decor, maybe even a little "Hole in the wall" type. I wasn't excited about eating here but we were pressed for time. Glad we stayed! I ordered beef pho and my husband ordered a grilled meat dish. The raw veggies to be added to the soup were so fresh and crisp The bowl was huge, enough to feed 2 people for 8.95! The broth alone was excellent. Very flavorful on its own, but made even better with the meat. Would have liked to add more meat, but the price was appropriate. This place is a solid 4 stars but I gave it 5 because others have it underrated on Yelp.

Great Vermicelli bowl. Clean and comfortable restaurant with open kitchen. 

Not sure you will find better Vietnamese food in the area.
Pho here is really good and the egg rolls are to die for,  very good customer service. Will continue coming time and time again.
Good pho , good service but $20 CC minimum is ridiculous

Bigger fan here than I am of the one in the Southwest.  The servers here tend to pay attention to your order and what it is that you say.  If you tell them that you have an allergy to a food item, they will not put it in your food.  Far better staff here than their sister restaurant Jenni Pho.

My husband and I were shopping at Macy's Furniture Store and on the spur of the moment he suggested we stop at Jenni Pho Grill and try the PHO. After living here for 18 years, we had pretty much given up finding a good Vietnamese restaurant. But Jenni Pho did not disappoint - in fact, it was perfect. From the minute we walked in and were greeted with a very warm and friendly hello to the excellent service and wonderful food our experience was superb. Instead of the PHO I had the sour soup (I can't remember the Vietnamese Name) and my husband had the chicken rice dish. Both were amazing. I am still craving the soup and will definitely be back for more. This would make a good take out dish to eat at home later - Our order was so large we took it home for leftovers and ate for the next two days (it kept getting tastier every day). OMG Jenny it's wonderful!

Jennifer the owner stopped by and introduced herself while we were dining. She is a lovely and charming hostess and that extra interest was very pleasing.

If you're looking for the best Vietnamese dining try this restaurant.

I came here on a family vacation and we wanted viet food. This restaurant is pretty good but a little pricey compared to other places. I got the Bun Cha Gio and I thought it was very good I also ordered the Thai tea and it's not as good like official boba stores but it's decent for a restaurant made drink.

Not happy. We went there by default because the korean bbq next door was closed before the time posted. We just came off the airplane and was hungry. We order the pho and it didn't taste like pho. None of the aroma smell of pho. None of us finish the bowls. It just wasn't pho. It was noodle, meat and brown broth. The fixing came out and we thought it was weird the bean sprout was cooked. Usually restaurant cook them to save them from going bad. The basil leaves were old and tiny.  The waiter didnt fill our water. The waiter just took our order, brought it out and never came back to check on us. It took him awhile to remember to come back to get our order. He There's plenty of other pho places on spring mountain. This place lost all hope for a good bowl of pho place in vegas.
Also recommendation, wait staff should be more friendly and greet us and check on us instead of disappearing

Great place for Pho on the south west side. Staff is always friendly and food is always on point. They also do a buy one get one on their delicious pot stickers when you dine in.

Only down fall is they ONLY take cash. There is a ATM machine inside but still inconvenient. Not to big of a deal. Still keeps me coming back

Server: Heily
Mature Asian woman who actually smiles!
A+

My first time dining here was wonderful. 

Heily is very kind and attentive. 

Our table ordered a good portion of the menu and the one thing that stood out is that the beef is exquisite (tender/pink)...oddly too perfect. 

I needed it to be a bit on the medium well because of my poor preference for how I need to eat firmer meat. Lol. 

When I brought this to Heily's attention...she knew exactly how I felt. 

I appreciated the fact she was capable of empathizing with me.  

The food and service were excellent. 

Thank you for the meal!

We went once and had awesome food and equally good service. The last time that we went was awful. It seems like the staff has a lot of turnover because I did not recognize any of the workers. When we walked in, the neck tattooed host was scratching his crotch and rubbing his face. We were very, very hungry and figured that since he wasn't a cook, we would reluctantly let it go. I explained to him my special dietary needs and asked him if there were any dishes that they could customize for me. He went to the kitchen and quickly came back with a "no" answer. The host did not care to work with me; their food is prepared a certain way and that was that. So, we left.
Quick service.  A good set of spring rolls with peanut sauce, and a Jenni Pho.  Exactly what I was looking for, but didn't blow me away.  Would come back!

Honestly I'm a huge foodie and ESPECIALLY when it comes to pho. Its my favorite food in the whole world and have tried in vegas, cali and even utah haha. Anywhere I can get my hands on pho. I can't recommend jenni pho enough. Clean enviornment and the food is of top quality. I always get the vegan pho with extra chicken. Have even converted people from the distasteful place that is pho kim long and when you go to jenni pho especially at night when the owner jenni is there, youll be beyond taken care of. The food is tasteful, pho is flavorful, clean and not greasy like other places. Even the other dishes like the grilled pork skewers with rice is so good!  Usually i dont venture out but jenni doesnt let you down lol come through and you wont be disappointed

I really like this place when we visited Vegas last time. It was their grand opening, and so we got a 10% off discount for life! The place is very clean, and nicely decorated. I had the Pho, and it's one of the best in Vegas (even better than Pho #1). I love their jelly fruit drink...it's buy 2 get 1 free, and it was really good. The prices are on the low side, compare to other restaurants like Pho Kim Long.

So far, I give this place a 5 star, because of excellent authentic Vietnamese food, great service, and super clean and nice decor. I have only been here once though, so I will update if this changes.
The food here is great! It opens late at night, which makes the best late night meal. The servers were nice and have a wide selection of Vietnamese food.

Was in Vegas this past weekend and some friends recommended JenniPHO in Chinatown...

First I want everyone to know that I've used Yelp many times before to find a good spot to eat in Vegas, and the last few times i was really let down...

For example:

Stay away from PHO KIN DO!!!! They have good ratings but the food is horrible!!!

Now Back to Jenni-PHO, by far the cleanest and best service I've had in Las Vegas.. I'm from So Cal, so I'm a Pho connoisseur "at least I think so"... and this place was delicious!!! Service was great and the Pho was super tasty.. it had a different aroma to it, not too sweet or salty... you just HAVE to try it... its BOMB!!!! 

Don't need to order a large cause they only have one size, and it's a BIG bowl.

Vegetables were really fresh... don't think I've seen bean sprouts that fresh before... 

I started with Spring Rolls and Egg Rolls.... 

Spring rolls were really crisp and fresh, good portion of meat and veggies... Peanut Sauce was tasty and original too... egg rolls were fresh and crispy too...

I had the Pho with Rare Steak and Tendon, again soup was hot and tasty...  meat was fresh and i DRANK ALL THE SOUP!!!! "I don't do that often" =D

Finished it off with a JenniPHO Dessert... that was super good too... not sure what it was but it was Green and my GF was in love with it...

The Decor was really cool... you can see right into the kitchen and the place was spotless.. very hip and modern...

Wait staff was very attentive and I never had to ask for my water to be filled... Good Job guys... I love's my water after I long night of DRINKING!!!!!

Overall, I think I've found my go to place in Vegas... Goodbye Pho Kim Long and all you others that MSG ME out every time I go... HELLO JENNI-PHO!!!!!!!

Not sure where these 5-stars come from. This place isn't even run by Vietnamese people and nobody speaks the language. The servers don't know the name of the dish they're bringing out.

The one star because the Pho soup is way bland. It is decently hot, but no flavor. Beef is dry and tasteless, like sand paper.

Don't be fooled by the shill ratings. 

Sigh, my search for a good Pho place in Vegas continues...

JenniPho you're always my cure to hangovers in Vegas, and once again you saved my life after a night of wild fun at XS ringing in the New Year.   Jenni-Pho always and forever the place to get your hangover cure fixings!

I have tried many pho restaurants in the valley and every time I try a new place I am dissapointed, because they don't match up to Jenni Pho. The restaurant itself has an amazing smell to it... that I can't quite put my finger too but I love it! I always get the Pho Tai Nam. I love it! The broth has so much flavor to it. One of my favorite restaurants in Vegas.

We just finished eating here and have been here a few times. We also know that these folks, for whatever reason don't except cards! This time we ate here, I miscalculated how much cash I had and had to use that stupid ATM machine to take out cash with a $3 charge for the machine and a $2.50 charge from my bank!!!

I gave two stars because the food is ok but i'm done with this place after that bullshxt ATM fee crap. I also believe they own the ATM machine and use that as a form of making more $$. What these morons don't realize is that no matter how good the food, people don't like being ripped off!!!

This is the last time i'll ever eat here! Now they can shove that ATM up their axxes!!!

It's good, not great. Food wasn't authentic as I thought it would be. The taste of the food is as if it lost its culture. Service wasn't really there; Just took our orders forgot a few things, dropped off food and only checked up on us once everything was finished.

The food is good.....except for 

1.  when we were paying at the cashier, saw the server putting together the vegetables for pho and touching her hair at the same time.  We told the cashier but he didn't seem interested on what we are saying.  

2.  They said 20 minutes wait for boba but we never received it.  The server never came back to let us know what happened.

3.  After we got our food, nobody came back to check on us to see if we are doing fine or if we needed anything.

We won't come back....and DO NOT RECOMMEND this place for SANITARY reason....

Very disappointing, service was very slow, waiter did not come to refill drinks, my wife's pho came out lukewarm. I ordered a chef's special, flavorless bowl of noodles and floating pieces of tofu. Waiters were polite though, from what little we seen of him.

Walking into Jennies Pho, it is very presentable and modern. Very clean restaurant. The service is very attentive and listening, but the food is where it dips a little under. Their pho lives up to the other reviews, the broth is very bland! The chicken wings also have no flavor and is tasteless. Good service, sub-par food.

Came here last year and it was amazing.  I can't say it was the same during this visit. Pho LOST ITS FLAVOR! I had to ask for cilantro, but that didn't help. Service was average. With the other pho restaurants to try in the district, I probably won't come back.

This should be NO stars!!!  We ordered our food and begin eating.  My friend went to the bathroom and when he came back, he said the cook was doing #2, flushes the toilet, walks out without washing his hands.  Be aware!!!  Disgusted about the situation, we ask for the check.  The waiter notices we hardly ate and asks if everything was okay.  We explained the situation and he just Oh
Sorry.  We also found a piece of plastic in our soup.  What a waste of time.  The messed up part is that we paid for the lunch.  Never again.  You have been warned!!!

This is by far one of the best Vietnamese restaurants that I've been to with my boyfriend. Great customer service, nice servers, good food, good portion, beautiful environment. We came from Houston, TX to try this well talked about place and we both LOVE it. It's unacceptable to not stop by here while in town! My boyfriend is a pho-natic and he says Jennipho has not only met his expectations but exceeded them!

Great food and good service. I have been to both locations, but i prefer Rainbow even though its a farther drive for me. The quality has always been good and the food is better than any of the other dives like pho so 1.

Clean restaurant,  clean kitchen, open glass kitchen,  you can actually see inside. You can see the cooks whipping up your pho.  This place is so clean. All and I do mean all pho places smell like someone spilled the fish sauce and spread it around the restaurant with a dirty mop.  Not Jenni-pho,  it's so clean,  I love it.
Food is good but what keeps me coming back the service here is way better the pho Kim long and pho so 1 and its not all always as packed either

Called ahead for a pickup order. Ordered Vermicelli noodles with shrimp, pork, and egg roll. My order was ready promptly. Pork cooked and marinated perfectly. Shrimp was a little bit overcooked and the egg roll was not as crispy as when dining in. I guess I had to eat there in order to taste the freshness. The vegetables were very fresh tho. Overall, JEnni pho is a good restaurant that satisfied my hunger.

Thia was our first time here. We each got a different bowl.  Shrimp bowl and a beef bowl. Both were good. Just wish there were more vegetables in the soups.    Not sure if that was normal to lack vegetables.  There were at least lots of bean sprouts and jalapenos.

The appetizer sampler was good to try especially if you could not make up your mind on which one to select. We may eat here again when visiting las vegas unless we find a better place. Keep in mind we ended uo here because it was Christmas eve and it was one of the few restraunts open after midnight in the area. Also we wanted to try something different. 

Our server Andrew was helpful and nice.

Jenni Jenni, I got your number.
I've been trying to try your Pho for a long time now but Sora is always right by you giving me that jealous look and I'm just trying to avoid some drama! You have been seducing me for too long now and finally I couldn't resist and gave up to your temptation.
I had the seafood Pho, the broth was light and flavorful and it had plenty of seafood in it, I added the extra vegetables that came on the side and it added a crisp touch to the soup. The bowl was big enough to make it a complete meal by the time I was done I was full and satisfied, all I needed was a nice cigar but had to settle with a Thai tea which it was also very good.
Jenni I will keep you on my list Pho emergencies, I'm so glad I found you. I love that you are available for me very late at nite. (10am - 6am) I can always stop and see you when I'm out drinking late with boys and after Sora had gone to sleep.  XOXO

Came here December 28. I understand it's busy due to the holidays and all, but i was pretty disappointed. Waited about half an hour to be seated...8 of us, 4 young children... Saw a group of about ten people walk in, walk to the back and seat themselves after one member gave the owner a nice hug. Finally sat down... 30 seconds later, server wanted to take our orders... Told him we needed minute... Waited forever for him to come back, ordered. Poor prefer included three phos with no onion. After waiting another 20 minutes one of our party asked where the heck was our food??! A server asked, "no onions, right?" "That's right. Three with NO onions." 7 minutes later, half our phos come out.... the three non onions had to wait another 7 minutes...
And it had plenty of onions on top and inside when it finally did decide to make an appearance. Wow. So no tip, but i give a few stars because the pho itself was pretty good, the server was friendly and possibly sincere enough and the owner offered to give a small discount after our complaint. But, for sure NOT returning.... At least not during any holiday... I could be more forgiving because we had to wait a long time (left the restaurant two hours later), but on top of the loooooong wait, they messed up our order after double checking it???!!!! So can't give a great review! Sorry Jenni!
PS. What is up with the women's restroom??! One door had no lock, the other one you had to lift the door to lock!! Heard a lot of angry ladies....
Went here in a recommendation,  portions and service were great, pho soup base a little sweet.

Food was ok. Not worth the wait. Two of the people on my table got their food 20 mins before the rest of us did so while my brother and i waited for out food my mom and bf were basically done with their food. In my opinion all of the food should come all at the same time, not at 20 minute intervals. I won't be coming back.

Ordered Pho.  They got wrong noodle in.
Asked to fix it they brought it back with added proper noodle. Took 15 mins
Since there wasn't enough soup asked to fix it. Took 15 min again.  Needless to say the noodle kinda looked funny by the time we got to it.
As we got the bill... they charged for extra noodle and soup? WTF?
BELOW AVERAGE ASIAN RESTAURANT SERVICE.
Never ever.

New pho place located in Chinatown, next to Sura KBBQ in the same area as the Macy's Home Department Store. Well not really new, its a new branch of the one off of Ranbow and Robindale. Opened really recently, there was a special for free food. Of course who can say no to free? I've tried the first location before and wasnt really impressed but was willing to try again. I had tried the Pho Dac Biet there before. 

Came here on a Tuesday Night, before it opened at 5. Got "in line" with the few people who were waiting there too for opening. By the time place opened, there was a snake that led into the parking lot. The restaurant was designed almost 1/2 kitchen with open viewing (large windows) and the dining area. 

Service was pretty good. Fast and quick. 

The special was allowed either Pho Dac Biet (Special combination beef noodle soup), Bun Bo Hue (their pork based noodle soup), or the Com Suon (broken rice plate with pork chop), as well as thai tea. 

First time i came here, i got the Bun Bo Hue (because i had tried the Pho Dac Biet before at the other location), and my other friend got the Pho Dac Biet. Thai tea came pretty fast, as well as the food. Presentation wise, not bad. Flavor, average. I wouldnt say its the best but its not bad. I had a party of 3, anotehr friend had gotten the same item as me. The different sizes of the pork feet we had gotten was different. Mine was considerably smaller compared to hers. Luckily she didnt eat pork, so i got to eat it all. It was tender and not hard to eat. Flavor was decent. Nothing too special. Not really flavorful, but not bland either. Couldn't really tell if it was legit broth or MSG.  Amount of food, given per portion, was a little smaller than i had been used to, at for example Pho So 1. 

Next day, we had came here again for lunch. Wait wasnt that bad. Maybe 1/2 an hour considering peak lunch time and it was during this free food special. This visit, i had gotten the Com Suon. Came with two pork chops on top of the broken rice, slices of cucumber and tomato, with a side of the fish sauce. The rice was plain. Little if any flavoring at all. Added some of the fish sauce to compensate. The pork chops were pretty tender. Flavored pretty good. Bone in so be careful ! 

As i had said before, this was a special they were running for i guess the grand opening of the restaurant, for marketing purposes probably. Portion size and item availability may be a bit different when its operating normally. I hope their broken rice has more stuff, otehrwise, this is definitely not a place id go for that. 

Some older gen viet people like this place more compared to other vietnamese restaurants. For me, it was ok. Not the best, probably prefer Pho So 1 or Pho Saigon 8 more if i wanted Pho. 

OH ! SIDE NOTE ! I am not sure if they implemented this at this new location but at the other location, it is CASH ONLY. They may or already have implemented this so be careful, otehrwise you are going have to run to a bank or maybe use the ATM machine they may have on site.

Food here is AMAZINGGGG!!!!!! Today I tried Bo Kho and the flavor is so rich -- the beef is so tender and perfectly cooked, the carrots and daikon absorbs all the flavor from the delicious broth and melts in your mouth. Service is GREAT the staff is very friendly and helpful. I always have to stop by Jenni Ph everytime I'm in Vegas.

This was the most horrible experience. I am an avid restaurant goer and haven't had a BAD experience in a very long time, until now. We finished our meal. Waiter never checked on us mid way.  At the end, I had to go up to the desk and ask for the check. Took us 1 hr to cash out. No Rhyme or reason - we were not a bothersome table. My family of four ate, didn't ask for anything. We told the waiter at the beginning of our order that we needed Spring Rolls at the end. We finished our meal for a good 15 minutes before I had to walk up there myself.  Why did it take us 1 hour to cash out?  Because they suck at telling us our additional to go order of an appetizer was too hard to fulfill because they are out of spring rolls.

That's just dumb. One hour to cash out. Very poor service. The food was good. Average good food. But I will never come back to Jenni Pho again. I don't care how "creative" that name sounds.
Not much to say. Came here after the club and I wasn't impressed at all. Luckily, I was hungry.

Been here many times before, but the quality of the food and the service has declined. Waited 10 minutes until I finally had to get up and ask for someone to take my order...typical I guess for an Asian resturant. When he finally came to take our order he had an attitude. Bad business...will be my last time here. Too bad because the owners are really nice.
Came in and waited for more than 20 mins for a waiter to come by and ask what we want to eat and the restaurant isn't even busy.
I took my kids Here and the service was extremely poor. We waited 40 minutes at our table and the server never even came to take our order! We finally had to just go to another restaurant!
Came in January 1, 2014. New Year and the place was pack. Service is decent since there are few staff or waiter to cater the customer. Food is excellent and their prices is about right.

Went here couple months ago but forgot to finish my review draft. There was one waiter who had a staring problem. Kept telling one of the waitresses to look at me and when she couldn't see me he dragged her in front of me and told her to look. It was rude and made me feel a bit uncomfortable. Parties of 6 or more will be charged 18% gratuity and food was okay, nothing spectacular.

I've been going to Jenni pho ever since I was in high school. (Started at the Rainbow location) So about 6 years. And this place always has the best pho guaranteed. Always hot and fresh and delicious, and Jenni always hires the most reliable servers. They're always super friendly, and give their best service. I will never stop coming to this place, NEVER! Definitely in my tops favorite restaurants in Las Vegas, highly recommend this place to anyone craving some pho or vermicelli bowls!

And I also want to add how amazing Jenni is. Hard worker but she always makes time to make her customers feel welcomed and enjoy their experience eating here. It's amazing to see her business taking off since she only started off at the Rainbow, and the Spring Mountain location is such a success! Ever rarely do you see an owner with such love and passion for their business. Love it here!

Service was very poor, servers didn't know what they were doing. Dropping everything, we have been sitting for half an hour and still our food has not come out yet. Food is not all that great either. Well not worth my time in Vegas.

I prefer Pho So 1 for a late night Pho or Pho Kim Long. If only Saigon 8 was open for late night, that's my Pho of choice but I decided to come try this place out for the second time. The first experience wasn't bad at all here. This time around I probably wouldn't go back. It wasn't the food it was the customer service. I had to ask a couple times for my water to be refilled and I got the impression I was bothering them too much to do their job and it wasn't busy at all. There were 4 other tables and over staffed. The big issue was my change. My bill was $19.92. I gave them a $20 and I stood there waiting for my change. He looked at me and asked if there was anything he can help me with and I asked for my change. Then he told me "it's only $.08". As rude as it may seem but I told him "My change is my change, I don't care if it's a Penny and there's a possibility I might just let you keep it. It's the gesture of actually giving me my change and don't be rude about it either saying it's only $.08" Then he told me to wait for the change as he closed the drawer and cashed out another tables bill. Working in the restaurant industry I'm usually a good tipper. I already was set to leave $5 but I left them $2.08. I was about to just leave them $.08.

My family was in town. They want  to eat pho. Everywhere was busy when we got there and we didn't want to wait. So we figure to give Jennipho on spring Mt a try. We heard stories, we're not sure but we went anyways because everyone was hungry. When we got there, we got seated in less than 10 min. We order mostly pho and a few rice plates (grilled pork). We were surprised that their food was really tasty especially their pho. It was different for other pho place. My family was very happy. Their open kitchen was impressing. Their staffs are quite nice.
This place is nice and clean. Very polite workers. Fast cooks. And a great atmosphere overall. The broth is good and the rice plates are great as well. Definetely a place for lunch

Generally, if you're going to put a specific food in your restaurant name, I expect that dish to be your specialty. Sadly, at Jenni Pho, I found that the pho wasn't particularly impressive. 

Ordered the custom bowl with tripe, flank, and meatballs, and though the portion was large and noodles were plentiful, the broth itself was lackluster- not packed with flavor and earthiness as expected, given the process and ingredients it takes to make. Much doctoring was needed with the herbs and sauces at the table to make it palatable, and even then it was underwhelming.

But the vermicelli pork bowl knocked it out of the park. Loved the plentiful portion of pork, with just the right bit of char to add flavor, tons of noodles and fresh herbs and vegetables. It was essentially a noodle salad, dressed with fish sauce, and deliciously so. Would come back for this dish.

Service, as I've come to expect at pho joints, was nearly nonexistent. Placed our order, got our food, and never saw the guy again. That being said, they seem to be well-staffed and had several guys working in the open-plan kitchen: loved being able to watch what was going on, and appreciated that the kitchen (and windows peering into it) were so very clean!

I wanted to try this place out ever since I read Yelp's "New Business Openings in Las Vegas" section. I already had lunch though at the restaurant next door, but I decided to just pop on in and order some Pho to go. The staff here was very friendly and just real welcoming even though I wasn't sticking around to dine there. Offered me a drink while I waited too.
  
From my vantage point sitting in the waiting area which is partitioned off, I can see the dining area is fairly large and spacious with marble tabletops and wicker chairs that either seats 4 or tables that seat 6. The overhead lighting caught my eye, such fancy looking chandeliers.  It just sets the tone of a nicer dining experience here. At the entrance you can see your Pho being prepared and cooked from their open exhibition style kitchen area. 
  
My order didn't take long at all, was packed carefully and survived the 20 minute ride back home. I ordered the Rau Cai Pho (Veggie Tofu Beef Noodle soup) .  The beef broth had a nice seasoned taste, rice noodles were real good. Not mushy (cooked to order) , had chunks of broccoli, cauliflower and slices of carrots, the toppings, green onions, crunchy bean sprouts and the basil leaves were real fragrant.  Love the tofu that was fried golden brown and didn't get soggy when soaked in the broth.  Pho was perfect comfort food! I was happy with it. Serving was plenty for one and prices are pretty reasonable. Prices range from $6 - $9.  

From taking a quick glance at the menu I also saw they have a kids meal and "Create Your Own Bowl", appetizers, and some Chef's Specials you can choose from. The Bun Rieu Oc (Crab noodle soup) crab meat, tofu & Escargot in Tomato soup w/Vermicelli sounds delicious!   They also have a section of different Boba and flavored teas and slush ice drinks. The host who took my order said they're pretty popular and guests sometimes come in late night just to have that. Most definitely will be back for more! 

FYI - Bring Cash!! There is a $20 minimum to use debit and credit cards!

Our regular pho place was packed so we decided to give this establishment a try.  Pho was okay.   Nothing special except the thin slices of "steak" in mine were all clumped together in unappetizing chunks.  I had to separate the slices by hand to eat them.  I've had quite a bit of pho and never experienced that before.  The service was not great.  4-5 kids working this place and they all seemed like they were lost.  Beware they only serve cans of soda.  I hate places that only have canned sodas and worse we had to ask twice to get our sad little can of diet coke.  Never got a bill and when I went to the front to pay, the 2 guys were having a bitch fest about customers, bills etc. and ignored me until they were done talking.  With so many options for Pho especially in this area; the experience needs to be better than this.

open really late night I like that most since working swing shift won't get off till midnight.  It was my first time experienced Vietnamese noodles & so delicious! We always go to ramen place but I love pho totally fell in love with it   Lol.   Lots food & very reasonable price I found my spot now.

The broth is weak and there's a funny taste in the meatballs. The one on rainbow used to be one of my favorites. The food quality and flavor have really slipped with the expansion. Much better Pho one block either way.
Great potstickers! Fresh green tea was so good I took some to go. The rare steak pho was as good as it gets.  My first time here but will definitely come back with family.

As a pho connoisseur and transplant from the OC, I  came on a busy Sunday night with family not expecting much from a Vegas pho joint, but we were hungry and ordered bun bo hue, pho tai, grilled chicken rice and beef stew noodle soup. Clean and tidy with modern decor and young English speaking servers. My impression of the food will be made relative to area rather than OC standards:
1. Bun Bo Hue- broth is shockingly bland for this dish but meaty parts were good. Noodles were soft but acceptable. 2 of 5.
2. Pho Tai- very little selection for those accustomed to a variety of beef cuts/parts, you're limited to beef rare flank and/or meatballs, or chicken. Broth average at best, very little beef flavor, noodles clumpy but edible. Too much star anais  and funky flavor from noodles. 2/5.
3. grilled chicken rice- good moist chicken, tasty overall, 3/5
4. Beef stew soup- good stew brought down by over softened low quality rice noodles, but broth definitely flavorful and makes up for subpar noodles. Barely 4/5.

I would not return for pho or bun bo hue but would return for beef stew and grilled chicken rice. Pho beef broth is very complex and few places outside of OC get it right. Even in Saigon they rely on MSG to compensate for lack of skills. I will give Jenny Pho 3.5 out of 5, relative to Vegas, but in Cali, they would barely score a 2.

I REFUSE to eat pho anywhere else but here! The service is always amazing. The pho itself is to die for. The broth alone is the best I've ever had. It's always steaming hot and has so much flavor. 
I usually order the jenni pho or I create my own. Their spring rolls always taste so fresh. Jenni always walks around and talks to her customers, ensuring everyone is happy. She cares so much for her business and her customers, and the quality in her food really shows. I take all my friends and family here. Plus, they close late! Best hangover food. Love, love, love!

This place is delicious! the soup is very good.  My husband  ordered the super sized bowl of noodle soup (he's a big eater)  it was the perfect amount. It was only  a couple dollars more for double the amount. So it would be a good idea to maybe go with a friend and share a bowl of the supersize.  The costumer service was great and the place itself looked very nice. Overall we had a good experience here and would definetly come back again.
Great food, fast service, nice clean environment, and reasonable prices. If you have never tried Pho, this is a great place to get a genuine experience.

I have been here twice.  The first time they had a tough time because there was a group of eight people who got there before us, and there was so little wait staff that everything took a very long time.  Just eight people!  Anyway, I had the seafood pho.  The broth was very good, and I would say it was on a par with Saigon 8, which is one of the best.  The bowl of pho was interesting in a good way.  The fish pieces were actual good sized pieces of fish, not fish balls.  There were even baby octopus.

I was there a second time about a week later.  Service was faster.  However, there was a bit of a screw up by the waitress.  We got two bowls, and they weren't meant for our table.  I'd have eaten it anyway, and even put in sprouts, sauces, and so on.  I suppose I'd forgotten just what I'd ordered.  Then it was taken away.  My pho was pretty good, and by the way, I never saw that waitress again.

By comparison with other Viet Pho restaurants, there are differences.  They use lacquered chop sticks, rather than throw-away wooden ones as used by Saigon 8 and Pho Little Saigon.  The lacquered ones look classy, but are harder to use.  Tougher to hold onto the noodles.  Unlike other places, they bring the spoons and small empty dishes later, along with the meal.  My problem with that is that I cannot mix my dipping sauce while waiting for the rest of the stuff.  Also, they don't immediately bring out sprouts and greens and sliced peppers, which come out just before the pho.  I like using the sprouts to dip into the dipping bowl, kind of like you would do in a Mexican restaurant.  I know, it's just a whim of mine, but that's what I like to do.  Saigon 8 and Pho Little Saigon make it easy for me to do.

I enjoy coming here. The prices are great, the parking is great, and the portions are awesome and the staff is friendly. But recently the last 2 times I've come I've had the same male waiter, and both times he did not write down our order and both times our order has come out wrong. It's not going to stop me from coming here but I'm sure I'll be asking for a different waiter from now on just to be sure my order is taken correctly.

Update: So within 10 min of my original review, Jenni, the owner came out with the waiter and personally apologized for both times. Very sincere, very nice, very awesome. Jenni is awesome, but she did ask for ways to fix what went wrong and also informed us about the anniversary coming up which sounds exciting and most likely will be attending. Jenni thank you again!

The service at this place is terrible. 
After we finally sat down, we waited another 15 minutes just to get someone to take our order. We waited another 15 minutes and no food came out at all. Water wasn't refilled, even after chasing someone down to ask what was going on, we get blown off.
I wish I could comment on the food, but we took off. 
Waiting 30 minutes for food is inexcusable, especially for a Pho joint. There are so many Pho joints on this street alone. Why should I put up with this?
If you go here anyways, I hope you have better luck than we did.

I use to love this place until their customer service went downhill. I gave it plenty of chances, but I couldn't do it anymore. I would go the whole meal with no refills and napkins cause the waiter would never check up on us. When they finally decide to check up on us it's just to send us the bill. What really made me stop coming here was the time I went with my brother and there were ants crawling from the floor to the ceiling right behind him! When I brought it to the waiters attention he laughed it off and said he will take care of it. He didn't seem shocked at all...

It took about 30- 45minutes for my family of 4 to be seated & served. Food wasn't any good. My pho's soup lacked flavor & my parents said their com tams weren't great either. The only good thing was the chicken in my sister's com tam, although even she complained about the rest of her dish. The restroom is tiny. I wouldn't recommend this for sure. Head down the road & eat at the Thai place Kung Fu or any other pho place. Save yourself the time. We spent over an hour here bc of how slow it was. & if you're paying card you have to tip 15% or higher.

Its always a great time for pho. When I first moved to Las Vegas 4 no this ago I was worried that I wouldn't find a good place to eat Pho. A friend introduced me here. Such an awesome restaurant with excellent. Customer service. Since being here in Vegas, I eat here at least 3x a month. They have 1/2 off appetizers!!! We always get the Gyoza (BOGO). The environment is relaxing and feels like a home. Very cool and fun employees. The prices are Excellent, especially for the Super size Photo, double everything! Perfect combination after a long night of drinking!!! They ate open till 3am!

Took family from out of town here since it was new. We are Vietnamese, so we are a little critical when it comes to our pho. The broth is the most important part and it taste like its straight from the can. The waiter was good and service was fine. No soy bean milk?? Better off waiting in line at pho kim long.

love it!! we were driving around looking for a reasonable priced place to eat and one of our friends found this place, so glad they did. to be honest I dont remember what I ordered lol but I do remember I loved the food and the milk tea with boba was amazing and next time im in vegas im coming back!

First time trying the place. Nothing special about the pho. Portions were small. Service was terrible has to ask many time do water and refills and when my pho came they didn't bring any of the fixings. By the time they came back with them I had already almost finished my soup. Might give them another chance if I'm desperate only because they are open till 6am

Jenni Pho Grill is a Pho-nominal place to grab a delicious meal!

If you are in the Las Vegas Area, you need to give this place a try.  I recommend their #1 named after the restaurant.  

Excellent food, tons of parking and great service make this place the spot to go to when in town.

Extremely SATISFIED!!! It has become one of my favorite PHO places to come eat!!!! :D 
I recommend the shrimp PHO soup it's amazing!!! The Thai tea isn't the best I've  tasted I don't recommend it at all!! Other then that everything I've taste is so GOOD!! ;)

i am another one of those reviewers that wanted to go to sora but ended up here because sora was closed.
plus, i hadn't had pho in some time.
i really love pho.
ever since my friend's mom made me my first bowl when i was a young 20-something.
of course, nothing has come close to being that good but there are places in town that make a tasty bowl of pho.

jenni pho's food is good.
the pho is decent, has good flavor and is substantial.

the problem here is, first and foremost, the service.
our server appeared too cool for school, didn't really seem to want to be there and just had this "better than thou" attitude.
secondly, my soup had metal sponge parts in it.
thank goodness i didn't swallow any of the pieces.
the cashier was kind enough to remove my pho from our bill because of this but then proceeded to screw things up even more so.
when we went to pay with our credit card, she asked to see my hubby's i.d. which is ok but then she took his i.d with her to her station.
after she ran his card and brought it back to our table with his i.d., we noticed that she had written his d.l. # on the back of the credit card slip.
oye!!!
you can't do that!!!
so, we scratched it out, signed the slip and left, with no plans to ever return.

food - 4 stars.
deduct 1 star for metal sponge parts in my broth.
deduct 1 star for taking dl and writing down dl # on back of receipt.

If you have a craving for some great Pho this is the place to go! The food is always well made, tastes great, and is well priced. One of the best parts about this restaurant is the service! The owner, Jenni, is often working in the restaurant herself and makes the experience so wonderful. The environment is classy and welcoming and even has a clean open kitchen where you can see them cook your food! They always have specials on their Thai Teas (Buy two get one free!) and often have specials like half price appetizers! My main dish there is the Shrimp Pho and I add veggies to mine. I look forward to it everytime and I'm never disappointed. The food and the staff make this an amazing dining place!

Today was my first time trying it, it wasn't too bad but I've had better.
The service wasn't good at all, he messed up one of our orders and not once did he check on my table. 

Food was decent, service could of been better. Maybe it was just an off day for them. Overall decent place if your on the go and need a quick fix.

Service: 5 stars
Ambience: 5 stars
Food: 5 stars

I don't understand how anyone can knock this place. The server told us that they've been opened 1 month. For being a new restaurant, I'm really impressed by the way they cared on how we found this place. I love pho and this is one of the best pho I've had. Give this place a chance! It's better than the place down the street... Pho Little Saigon---pho-get that place!

Not much to say about this place. All I can say is, I've had better.

We came here on a Monday afternoon. Hungover from a long night of drinking and living the Vegas life ;) 

When we arrived we were seated immediately. Which was good cause we were hungry and happy there wasn't a wait. However, the waiter was extremely slow. He took over 20 minutes to come back and take our orders. Another 15-20 minutes to bring us waters and any other beverages people may have ordered. Luckily the pho didn't take as long to come out after he put in our order. 

Overall: I wouldn't recommend or come back here. The service was horribly slow and the pho just tasted okay.

Pho here is very flavorful. The meat portions are generous and they have an open kitchen layout so you can see your food being made. Our server was attentive and the store itself is clean. 

My boyfriend decided to be adventurous and try the XXL pho...IT WAS HUUUGE!!!! He managed to finish it. I think we finally found a place where he can get full off of just pho haha. I don't remember if the price for that pho was listed on the menu, but in case you're curious: it came out to $15 or $16. 

JenniPho is a place that I will definitely be visiting again soon. Bonus points for them being open late to satisfy those early AM pho cravings.

I love this place! It's always clean, the staff is friendly and the food is good!
Jenny is such a sweet and friendly owner! She even gives awesome hugs!!!
I love their pho and that they're not stingy on their meats! Especially their yummy tripe!
I love their spring rolls and their potstickers. 
I usually have the same thing every time.
But so far everything has been great! 
Love this place!!!!! 
The pho is very tasty!!

Can seem to find any good bun bo hue anywhere in Las Vegas. Why can't anyone make good bun bo hue here. I miss Vietnamese food in the bay area (San Jose). Their pho here is ok. Saigon 8 is better for pho.

Since there was a long wait at Ramen Sora, my husband suggested we eat here instead.

The service was good. The staff was friendly. Our water was always filled.

Unfortunately I can't say the same about my food. I ordered the pho with steak and tripe. This is the only thing I get at Vietnamese restaurants. When it was brought out, it looked like it was going to be amazing. The bowl was huge. However one sip of the soup and I was greatly disappointed. It was unbelievably bland. A good broth is what makes a bowl of pho great since the noodle itself is typically flavorless.

Maybe I've been spoiled by all the delicious pho in San Gabriel Valley, but this was very underwhelming. 

Lesson learned. Next time just suck it up and wait. There's a reason why there is a line.

Came back here after our vacation in September! Came for a convention this time but craved the authentic food! Excellent service and quality. Prices are reasonable and so much food! Lots of great options and I'm obsessed with the Thai tea. Something we can't really get in Toronto. All the buffets and fast foods in Vegas can quickly become the same and boring. Come here if you'd like a great meal with fresh ingredients and try something different. I found the restaurant to be very clean and friendly and had no issues what so ever! Hopefully, I'll be able to come back soon!

Food was great! I love the broth and overall a good taste! We ordered egg rolls as an appetizer and the soup came out before so we had to cancel our order of egg rolls. Would've gotten more stars but service was sub par.

I hate that this is my very first negative review here but it was such a bad experience that I was itching to get out of Jenni Pho! You can ask anyone that I know and 10 out 10 will tell you that I am in no way a picky person. So...that means a lot. 

Drinks came after food....had to remind her twice we ordered a beer and 3 Thai teas. 6 people but spoons and forks for 3 people? Table was so uneven that drinks and bowls kept almost landing onto my lap. Had to put Every Single Thing on napkins to keep them from sliding. 4 adults and 2 small children meant automatic 18% gratuity. 

Omg...the food...Tom Yum Soup is meant to be Sweet/Sour/Spicy but all 4 of us agreed that it was just spicy water with whatever leftover stuff they had. Not at all sour which is the signature taste of tom yum soup. The Bo Luc Lac (Shaking Beef) was plain and was probably still Mooing when it got to the table. The Thai tea had too much Water to powder ratio. (There was no way that was freshly brewed) Will be the last time I come here. Sorry!

I love Jenni Pho food.  I love the Bun Bo Hue, I love the pork chop rice, I love the pho.  I can't get enough of it.  My friends and I will always go to Jenni Pho for food on Rainbow when we are in Vegas.  Now that she has her new location on Spring Mountain, we don't need to drive all the way out there for food!  And now it can be our go-to place after our crazy nights on the strip!

I love how the kitchen is open and the place is always clean.  There is nothing sketchy about it.  

And what the heck are people talking about the service? I mean, have these people been to places like Pho Kim Long?  Yikes, terrible service!  I've always gotten really good service at Jenni Pho and the staff is always friendly.  Great food, great service, great location.  What is there not to love about this place?

This place USED to be our favorite place. The last few times have just gotten progressively worse. (One time we got there before they supposedly closed but they decided to close early and Another time, they changed their hours) the cleanliness is suspect. There was a time we came here and were sat at a dirty, sticky table. This place has also been shut down multiple times for many offenses by the health department. 

This time, we thought we might give this place one more shot. We walked in the door hoping for a good experience. We noticed that The sauces are no longer in the squeeze bottles, they are in little glass containers with plastic spoons in them. I find this one of the most unsanitary "new" things that they started to do. We don't know how other people used it. What if they licked the spoon, or set it on the dirty table and then put it back in the jar? They used to offer hot tea for free, but now they charge $2.50 for it. When the "hot" tea arrived at the table, it was cold. The bowl of pho came and it barely had any actual pho (noodles!). There was no cilantro, and the broth was watery. What a waste. Will not be coming here again.

Came here once and wasn't too sure if I wanted to return. Food was okay, just had better. I had the bun riue and it had real crab but it was missing something. I added more fish sauce but it didn't have the taste I was used too. We had the spring rolls wasn't all.that great.

Came here w/ 3 friends. They ordered Pho & Bun Bo Hue. Their order came out and 20 mins later my Bun Tom Nuong still hadn't came out hahahaha .. Ironically that's supposed to be the fastest dish out. I went ahead and cancelled my meal.

The food is great the portions are perfect and the sevice is outstanding...the only problem is they have a 20.00 min to use debt, this is a problem for me Because I usually go by myself and don't carry cash so I probably won't come back because I can get the same great food service and portions two minutes down the street and use debit anytime I want.

SORRY JENNI, I REALLY WANNA SAY IT'S NOT YOU. IT'S ME. BUT IN THIS CASE, IT'S ALL YOU!

So here were the events leading up to this decision. 

It was a cold thursday night. I would say it was about 47 degrees with the wind blowing which made it even colder. So a hot bowl of pho would sure hit the spot. The wifey suggested our usual pho place. I wanted to be adventurous and try this new place based on the 4 star average. So off we went.

We come in and are greeted warmly. We sit down to a really nice glass table with what looks like seashells. I look around to see some nice chandeliers. I must say the decor is very nice. But just like any other relationship, once you get to know the person, you find out they are not who you thought they were.

So comes the unpleasantries. 

First off, I think they had the thermostat set to 70 degrees. BELOW ZERO. At first I thought it was just me. But after I looked around, I noticed everybody else in the restaurant had their jackets on. First strike.

I order their namesake, which is your standard combination. Came out at a decent time. Nothing out of the ordinary. If anything, it was a LITTLE MORE GREASY than I wanted. Second strike.

So we finish our our soups and ask for the check. We ordered two of the same soup at 7.99 a pop. So the total was 17 and some change. As I pull out my debit card, our server tells us that there is a 20 DOLLAR MINIMUM TO USE PLASTIC. Say what? You would think that they would at least have an ATM there but no. Even if they did have one you would still have to pay a convenience fee to withdraw cash along with whatever your financial institution might charge you on top of that. Third stirke.

So to make up the difference, we decided to get a milk tea with boba for 2.99 to push the total over 20. We get our drink. I take a sip. THE BOBA WAS HARD. For those that are not familiar with boba drinks, the boba is supposed to be soft and chewy. That was the fourth strike.

Now if this was baseball, they would of struck out plus an extra strike, unless they were bowling, in which case you would have 6 more frames. Originally I wanted to give them only 1 star, but the service and the decor were decent so I was gonna give them the benefit of the doubt meaning I am willing to give them another try at a future date. I will update this review accordingly based off of that.

So Jenni, we just need some time apart. This relationship looks like its not going anywhere except straight to this review. Maybe next time I see you things will be much better. Until then, I wish you luck.

I came here with a few of my friends, we were visiting from out of town. I didn't set my standards very high because I didn't expect to find better Vietnamese food than Orange County here in Vegas. I ordered the bun bo hue and it was surprisingly good. I was curious our server, Michael, about his tattoos and that turned into a mini conversation. He was hospitable and always made sure we got what we needed (extra napkins, forks, extra plates because we split some dishes amongst ourselves). I'd probably come back again the next time I'm in town - open late, good service

So I gave this place a two stars because the Pho was good and full of flavor, but the customer service is horribly unacceptable (with the exception of the hostess who was very attentive).  I'm pretty patient, but I literally had to wave down someone to get their attention so I could get a refill on my water.  This is expected when a restaurant is busy, but there was only 2 other parties dining (one being a two-top) and workers just gathered to talk stories. 

   After we ate, my friend wanted to order Boba to go.  We waited another 10 minutes before my friend decided she was going to have to wave someone down again.  She got someones attention, but instead of coming up to help us, he yelled across the room and said: "Can I get you anything else?"  She went along with it and tried to order from a distance, but when he couldn't figure out what she was saying, he finally decided to approach us at the table.  I took this opportunity to order an Ice Coffee for my girlfriend, but without the ice.  She has a long day tomorrow and wanted the coffee for the next day (which is why I asked to hold the ice).  To my surprise, the cup arrived with it being  1/2 empty!  I've never seen that before! (http://s3-media2.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/gJWJ8YmQK2_oaUSmnbTYiA/l.jpg) Seriously...End of review. I'm never coming to this place again.  *

Every time we're in Vegas and want some good Vietnamese food we always go to Jenni Pho.  They have the best bun bo hue and egg rolls!   My kids also love the beef pho, the broth is so tasty and authentic.  Their com tam combination is my husband favorite especially the  pork chop very flavorful and he loves the portions!!  
 
Jenni Pho is so nice and clean not dirty like other pho and Asian restaurants.  You can actually see the kitchen and how they cook through the glass window that is so awesome I've never seen that at any Asian restaurants.  I love the atmosphere and the service.  You never see that at any Asian restaurants!!

Thanks Jenni Pho we had a good weekend every time we're in Vegas and definitely be back again for the bun bo hue!!!

I was craving for Pho, drove by and saw about 20 people.  I guessed it must be really good.  Oh my... I was wrong... The broth was salty, and didn't smell like Pho at all.  I used 4 prices of lemon, still very salty.,and all MSG.  I have Pho at least one a week, and that was the worst Pho I ever had.   The restaurant is clean but the service and food were terrible.   There were four of us ( 2 adults 2 kids).  I ordered 3 special Pho.  I specifically asked for two small empty bowl for the kids and the scissors.  After 10 minutes, they came with one Pho and two small empty bowl, no scissors.  I had to ask again.   We thought that they might want us to feed the kids  before bringing out the other two.  After 10 minutes of waiting,  I called the waiter and asked for the Pho.  We found out he thought we only ordered one bowl  of Pho.  How smart huh?  Our phones were out of batteries, and they have the sign free wifi.  Since I had my iPad with me, I asked them for the password so I can log in.  The waiter gave it to me in a piece of paper.  Both my husband and I tried several times, however we could not log in.  He intentionally gave us a wrong password.  I gave him back the paper and told him you can have it back since we can't log in.  He said he'll check and be right back to try on my iPad.  He came back with the food and totally ignored that I wanted to use internet.  If you don't want customers to use your internet then don't offer.  I

Honestly, I enjoyed our dinner here. But we aren't super fussy people. The atmosphere was nice and the open kitchen and overall look of the place was clean and nice. I think out of all the pho places we have been to so far, this is my favorite. Food came out perfect and they actually serve the extra large bowl of pho here (my boyfriend has been disappointed by the other pho places in terms of size). The fried egg that came with my com thit nuong was made perfect and that's all I care about haha! Anyway, server was quick and nice. We were seated as soon as we walked in and waters came out right away as we looked at the menu. Good experience!

Pho is a tad oily but decent nonetheless.

Considering that it's Jenni Pho and not some regular joe shmoe pho restaurant in Chinatown, I went in with soaring expectations. It was a mediocre meal with decent service so it's not bad by any means, but I was slightly disappointed.

First off, there are still NO CREDIT/DEBIT CARD TRANSACTIONS. I just don't like to carry cash and rarely have 'em on me. Jenni Pho, why do you always make me take a trip to a Bank of America to take a withdrawal of $40 bucks after a meal? Until these slowpokes update their system, take some cash with you.

Secondly, the service is not lightning-fast which many pho eaters may be accustomed to with other venues. You have to ask for extra napkins because there's no dispenser on the table and they only give you two napkins for each person to start with. The tables in the middle are terribly small and it's a joke that there's four chairs around them because it was crammed like a tuna can with three people.

The pho is pretty oily. The one reason why I liked the Jenni Pho on Rainbow is because their broth is usually very clean and less oily. The pho at this location just tasted very thick and saturated with unnecessary flavor.

Overall, it was a pretty mediocre meal. I know they will get better with time because it's new. I'm sure Jenni or whoever is in charge will straighten things out eventually. HEY JENNI, UPDATE YOUR SYSTEMS TO ACCEPT DEBIT CARDS, OK?!! Geez.

No service. Slow service. Bad customer service. We ordered a beef stew pho. Broth had no taste. The beed had no taste or the vegetable. We complained to the server his respond is: that's the beef stew we serve I don't know what you want me to do. I asked to exchange something else. His response: we don't do that. We left no tip. Horrible experience!
